title: United States History Since 1865
description: Survey of the second half of U.S. history, including reconstruction, industrialization, the regulatory state, foreign affairs, and the remaking of citizenship rights and society. Particular attention to how race, class, and gender shaped changing definitions of freedom and equality. Not open to students with credit in HISTÂ 207. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE Area D1 and USCP.
